update.description:
This allows Gazebo to build on Windows. I followed the standard tutorial instructions, and used Windows 10.

Most the changes are minor, and are necessary due to lack of proper c++11 support on Windows.

[Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/229/), and the style errors have been fixed.
update.title: Windows_build

content.raw: Works for me.

content.raw: Fixed in f5cc089

update.description:
This allows Gazebo to build on Windows. I followed the standard tutorial instructions, and used Windows 10.

Most the changes are minor, and are necessary due to lack of proper c++11 support on Windows.

[Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/229/), and the style errors have been fixed.
update.title: Windows_build

content.raw: Yup
[this PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/92/compile-ign-math-from-source-on-gazebo/diff) ?
I think we need to update the windows jenkins scripts. It looks like jenkins is using an old version of ignition math.

content.raw: This is disabling all compiler warnings. I think this is a good thing now that we have so many, but we probably want to turn this back on in the future. Should we add a note about this to the code?
